title: Dr. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary
short_description: Goa's only bird sanctuary, located on Chorao Island among the mangroves of the Mandovi River.
long_description: Dr. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary is an estuarine mangrove habitat, which is declared as a bird sanctuary, and located on western tip of the Island of Chorao along the Mandovi River, Goa, in India. The sanctuary is named after the eminent Indian ornithologist Dr. Salim Ali. The area is covered by low mangrove forests, creating a unique ecosystem for mudskippers, fiddler crabs, and birds. It is accessible by a ferry from Ribandar. The sanctuary is equipped with paved walkways (boardwalks) that run through the mangroves, and a watchtower for bird gazing.
wildlife_significance: Critical Mangrove habitat in Goa. Nursery for marine life.
major_experiences: Canoe ride through narrow mangrove creeks
guides_and_tips: Hire a local boatman for a canoe ride; they can navigate narrow channels where bigger boats can't go. Early morning is best.
how_to_reach: Ferry from Ribandar (near Panaji) to Chorao. Then walk/take auto to sanctuary.
conservation_notes: Mangrove restoration is vital here for coastal protection.
sample_itinerary: Morning: Take 7 AM ferry from Ribandar. Enter sanctuary. Canoe ride (1 hour). Walk on boardwalk. Breakfast at local Chorao cafe. Return.
safety_tips: Humidity is high; carry water. Mosquito repellent is recommended.

operating_season.off_season: June to September (Monsoon - heavy rain in Goa)
operating_season.season_notes: Open year-round but monsoon makes boating difficult.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Boat rates are negotiated with local boatmen usually.
